DataElement.preferredName: First Recurrent Disease Angiogenesis Inhibitor Therapy Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the name of the action or administration of an agent or endogenous substance that inhibits the formation and growth of blood or lymphatic vessels to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Recurrent Disease Angiogenesis Inhibitor Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to action or administration of an agent or endogenous substance that inhibits the formation and growth of blood or lymphatic vessels to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process of the initial return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: An agent or endogenous substance that inhibits the formation and growth of blood or lymphatic vessels.  In cancer therapy, angiogenesis inhibitors target blood vessels that supply tumors, thereby inhibiting tumor growth. (NCI04):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An agent or endogenous substance that inhibits the formation of capillaries from existing blood vessels. In cancer therapy, angiogenesis inhibitors preferentially target the new blood vessels that tumors require for oxygen and nutrition, thereby inhibiting the growth and spread of these tumors.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
